summary:
I am a consultant paediatrics at Abu Dhabi Health Services Company- SEHA, where I practice as an expert in paediatric diabetes, general paediatrics (including neonates) and emergency medicine. I have been working at SEHA since Dec 2022, and I am responsible for providing high-quality care to children and families, collaborating with multidisciplinary teams (subspecialties), and participating in clinical governance and research activities.

I have more than 17 years of experience as a paediatrician, with previous roles at NMC Healthcare, Princess Alexandra Hospital NHS Trust, and other NHS hospitals in the UK. I have held clinical leadership positions, such as head of diabetes unit, appraiser, and clinical team lead, where I led and mentored staff, improved service delivery, and initiated quality improvement projects. I have also been involved in medical education as an examiner, supervisor, and assessor for medical students and trainees. I have published multiple articles in peer-reviewed journals and presented at national and international conferences. I have received a Clinical Excellence Award and several commendations for my work. I am passionate about advancing the field of paediatric diabetes, medical education, and enhancing the health and well-being of children and families.

projects.description: An observational paediatric case series looking to assess if there is any temporal association between the sudden high incidence of newly diagnosed T1DM in children and the onset of CoVid19 in Harlow, Essex, UK

projects.description: QI project on studying the use of antibiotics in neonates in NICU setting, and introduction of Kaiser permanente sepsis risk calculator in reducing the overuse of antibiotics in NICU.

publications.name: Quality Improvement on iron infusions in haemodialysis patients with anemia of chronic renal failure
publications.description:
QI project on improving compliance with iron infusions in management of chronic anemia in chronic renal failure children on haemodialysis.
We successfully changed practice by conducting upto 3 PDSA cycles resulting in minimising wasteful investigations and optimising iron infusions.
DOI: 10.1136/archdischild-2015-308599.477

Quality improvement project on reducing the use of antibiotics in NICU, thereby impacting on antibiotic resistance. We used the Kaiser permanente sepsis risk calculator to optimise the use of antibiotics in early onset sepsis in newborns thereby improving care quality and patient outcomes.
publications.name: QI project: reducing use of antibiotics in NICU settings

message.text: Reflecting on the past two days attending the EPEC, Emirates Pediatric Endocrinology Conference held at Conrad tower, Dubai - met up with colleagues and brainstormed on relevant issues in the world of pediatric diabetes and endocrinology. I extend my gratitude to the organisers  # Dr Kaplan  # Dr Jamal Al Jubeh for giving me the opportunity to present DKA data from ED  @ Tawam hospital as e poster at the conference.

commentary.text: Standard contract Kashif, hope you are well
